title: How the super-rich do Halloween at home, from fake gravestones to £40,000 parties with a cast of spooky performers
text:
We're not quite at Halloween, but the specialist event decorators are already out in force in some of London’s grandest mansions, designing ever more outrageous ways to frighten the neighbours.

“In the last four or five years, Halloween has been getting bigger and bigger," says Becky Handley, a director at the creative event production company Theme Traders. "Far more private clients are having Halloween parties and in certain streets in Kensington, Knightsbridge and Notting Hill, there is competition to be bigger and better than everyone else."
